quest.name: At World's End
journal: The Radiant Host soldier has a message for the Scions of the Seventh Dawn.
objectives: Speak with the Radiant Host soldier.
Speak with the Radiant Host soldier again.
Speak with the Radiant Host soldier.
Speak with the Radiant Host soldier again.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: No matter what my father and the Forum say, giving up and abandoning this place cannot be our only recourse!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We have no better, safer course of action to offer them than fleeing to the moon. I know this. And yet, Vrtra and his people love their home. There must be something we can do...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Their solution sits ill with me. But if life has taught me anything, it's that there is little to be gained from arguing with Sharlayans. We must take it upon ourselves to find a better way.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Even were Vrtra to acquiesce to their proposal, just how do the Sharlayans intend to transport the nation's entire populace to the moon?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: That soldier of the Radiant there─if I am not mistaken, he accompanied Ahewann to Vanaspati. Could it be that he knew Vrtra's identity all along...?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Under normal circumstances, the Forum's proposal would be regarded as sheer madness. But when the sky burns, even madness can sound appealing.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Doubtless Vrtra is loath to abandon his home. And yet, absent other options, he cannot dismiss the option out of hand...

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Greetings, honored Scions of the Seventh Dawn. I have a message from His Excellency the satrap.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: “Brave Scions. You have my gratitude for aiding my people in this most trying of times.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: “Alas, matters here at Meghaduta prevent me from meeting you all in person.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: “As a token of mine appreciation, I have arranged for a feast to be held in your honor. May it nourish you in preparation for the trials ahead.”

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: ...Such are the words of Master Vrtra. The feast he speaks of awaits you at Mehryde's Meyhane. Pray make your way there whenever your business here is done.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We thank you for your kindness. Indeed, I was hoping we might find a place to discuss our next course of action, and that seems an ideal venue.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Ah, and to you, Forename Surname. There is someone we had hoped to introduce to you in particular.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: While I am loath to detain you further, might you spare a moment of your time?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: A personal invitation, knowing full well your services are in the highest demand right now? This must be important. Worry not─we'll save some food for you, so take all the time you need.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Thank you, friend. Whenever you are ready, please join me in the aetheryte plaza. I shall go on ahead.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Access to the aetheryte you see there has been restricted to a select few ever since the tower first appeared.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience, but it was deemed too dangerous to permit the free movement of visitors at a time of emergency─a risk we could not take.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: In light of recent developments, however, the satrap has decided that such restrictions would only hinder our efforts to combat the Final Days.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: As such, I would encourage you to attune with the aetheryte before proceeding along the corridor.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be wondering what this place is.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: You stand in the Hall of the Radiant Host, from where our leadership oversees all of Radz–at–Han's military operations.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Sundrop, our destination, lies just ahead.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Ah, so you're the one I've heard so much about?

dialogue.name: RESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: Wait, I know you! Ah, but forgive me. Idle chatter can wait.

dialogue.name: LIMSARESIDENTOFFICIAL
dialogue.text: Forename! We've been waiting for you!

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: Well, look who we have here! Word of your deeds in Radz–at–Han has reached the sultanate, so you know.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: The liberator of Ala Mhigo is always a welcome sight. If I can be of service in any way, just ask.

dialogue.name: ISHGARDRESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: ...Hm? Ah, sorry...I was─ Oh, Forename Surname! Ishgard remembers, let there be no doubt. The Fury favors us this day, that we may stand in the presence of a true hero.

dialogue.name: DOMANRESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: To think I would meet Doma's savior here, in this distant land...

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Welcome to Sundrop. Without further ado, allow me to introduce you to─

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Oho! So you're the famous Forename Surname, eh? I knew it the moment you stepped through the door! You've the look of one who's walked through hell!

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Shirabaht, please! You are speaking to the satrap's honored guest and a savior of our people. Can you not show a modicum of respect?

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: What disrespect is there in paying a fellow warrior a compliment? We're all friends here, or will be soon enough.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: More formally, then, for the benefit of my countryman. It is a pleasure to have you with us, O great champion of Eorzea, Scion of the Seventh Dawn, Warrior of Light, and all-round good egg, I'm sure.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you ask?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: What is this place?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Who are you?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: This talk of eggs reminds me I'm late for dinner...

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: I hear you've been to Kugane, where you'll have seen all sorts of foreign embassies and whatnot.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Well, we've got them here in Radz–at–Han, too. Other lands send delegates to oversee trade and diplomatic dealings. Then there are military matters to discuss, which is why all these officers are stationed here in Sundrop.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: A fool with too many scars and knees that ache in the winter! The name's Shirabaht, and I attend to business here. As for what sort of business, how can I put it...?

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Radz–at–Han welcomes delegates from other lands to oversee trade and diplomatic dealings. Then there are military matters to discuss, which is why all these officers are stationed here in Sundrop.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Bahahaha! A womanman after my own heart! I like that!

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Don't you worry─I'll keep it short. There's just a thing or two we'd like you to remember. First of all, about the room you're standing in now...

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Radz–at–Han welcomes delegates from other lands to oversee trade and diplomatic dealings. Then there are military matters to discuss, which is why all these officers are stationed here in Sundrop.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: I imagine you're more than familiar with each of the nations they represent, yes?

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: We've got representatives from Doma...

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Ul'dah and Ala Mhigo...

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Limsa Lominsa...

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Gridania...

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: And last─but never let it be said least─Ishgard. They're the eyes, ears, and mouths that bridge the distance between Radz–at–Han and their respective homelands.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: We've used this brief respite to share the details of our plight with our overseas counterparts.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: And wouldn't you know it, all of their leaders requested a few words from you specifically. You're a womanman in high demand, eh?

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: And so, would you mind regaling us with your own account? Indulge us before you indulge yourself.

dialogue.name: LIMSARESIDENTOFFICIAL
dialogue.text: I thank you for the report. The conditions under which men are turned to beasts, the aetheric anomalies you have observed...you have given us much to consider.

dialogue.name: LIMSARESIDENTOFFICIAL
dialogue.text: It is concerning that the first transformation apparently occurred before the skies turned red. 'Tis contrary to what one would expect...

dialogue.name: ISHGARDRESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: Thankfully, the information you conveyed to Lucia upon your return from the moon has already proved invaluable.

dialogue.name: ISHGARDRESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: As soon as reports of the calamity here in Thavnair reached the Grand Company of Eorzea and our Far Eastern allies, our leaders knew at once that the Final Days were indeed upon us. They began taking steps to assess the extent of the phenomenon's spread.

dialogue.name: ISHGARDRESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: Our agents were able to confirm that, for the time being, the skies burn only over the Bounty, including this island and Corvos.

dialogue.name: ISHGARDRESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: Alas, that is of little comfort...

dialogue.name: RESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: Aye. All throughout allied lands, there have been reports of people transforming into hideous beasts.

dialogue.name: RESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: From what little we have learned, these incidents are similar in nature to that involving the merchant Khalzahl.

dialogue.name: RESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: As was the case here, the victims underwent the change prior to the heavens being set ablaze.

dialogue.name: RESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: And so, while the burning skies have yet to manifest beyond the Bounty, the transformations do not appear to be subject to any similar restriction. If anyone anywhere overcome by despair can turn, then nowhere is safe!

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: That's about the size of it. Speaking of which, we ought to give these creatures a name, don't you think?

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Here in Radz–at–Han, we've taken to calling the first to change─which tend to be the biggest─“blasphemies.”

dialogue.name: RESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: As fitting a name as any. To ensure clarity in future communications, we shall urge our comrades to adopt this terminology.

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: Our leaders have taken measures to deal with the threat, to the best of our abilities.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: Aye. Each nation has assembled their own groups of elite soldiers to put down these so-called blasphemies and their spawn as and when they appear.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: At the same time, they are doing all in their power to put the people's minds at ease, and prevent panic and fear from spreading.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: That said...brave souls with the strength and fortitude to fell these terrible fiends are not easily found.

dialogue.name: DOMANRESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: Just so. And it is for that very reason that we turn to you.

dialogue.name: DOMANRESIDENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: Pray lend us your strength, and help us to slay the blasphemies that plague our homelands!

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Now, now...you don't have to give your reply before dinner. I should also mention that each blasphemy seems to possess wildly different characteristics. What works well against one may serve you poorly against another.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: So before you go rushing off to save everyone's day, have a word with the delegates. They'll tell you what to expect.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: ...And with that, I do believe our friend here has a feast to attend. Spare a thought for us while you're tucking into all that fine cuisine, eh?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have gained access to the role quests for Endwalker! A separate quest line and story is now available for tank, melee DPS, physical ranged DPS, magical ranged DPS, and healer roles.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To undertake these quests, speak with any of the delegates in Sundrop, and agree to help defeat the blasphemies that plague their respective homelands.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Thanks for taking the time to stop by. You're free to talk with our delegates more if the mood strikes you, or head off to your banquet if you've had your fill of words for the day.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Ridding the lands of blasphemies is an important task, to be sure, but one that's best done on a full belly and a good night's rest, if you ask me. Do take care of yourself, you hear?

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Pray forgive Shirabaht her rudeness. She can be a bit...boisterous at times, but it is simply her nature.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Anyway, my apologies for keeping you from your hard-earned rest. You will be rejoining your companions, yes? Do you know the way to the meyhane?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I know Radz–at–Han like the back of my hand!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I have a terrible sense of direction.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Glad to hear you're becoming familiar with our fair city. You'll be pleased to hear that all drinks are on the house, so order whatever suits your fancy.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: Truly? A remarkable weakness for such a well-traveled adventurer. Anyway, you can either use the Aethernet, or go by foot via the aetheryte plaza.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: From there, cross through Balshahn Bazaar and continue down the passage. You'll find yourself right in front of the meyhane.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: When you arrive, pray request the drink of your choice. Mehryde says that, tonight, it's on the house.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: And with that, I must return to my post. On behalf of all the Radiant Host, I thank you and your friends once more for lending your strength and courage to Radz–at–Han in our time of need.

dialogue.name: HANNISHROYALGUARD
dialogue.text: We shall endeavor to fight the good fight to the end, that we might honor Ahewann's legacy and serve Master Vrtra well. You have my word that your efforts will not be in vain.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forgive me for not waiting to make a toast. My throat was utterly parched...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I know I must eat to regain my strength, but between you and me, I don't have much of an appetite.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The threat here has been quelled, but our job's only just begun...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Good you could join us. Mihleel over there will be happy to take your order.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: How was your meeting with the Radiant? I would love to hear more...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I'm overdue for a good meal.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: Welcome! When the satrap asked us to entertain a party of honored guests, I was wondering who it might be... This is a lovely surprise, to say the least.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: By the way, I heard all about Khalzahl from your friend G'raha Tia. I understand there was nothing that could be done, but...I was heartened to hear he meant us no harm.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: I cannot thank you enough for dispatching the beasts. As the smallest token of our thanks, your food and drink tonight are Mehryde's treat. Speaking of which, what shall I start you off with?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: A piping hot mug of chai, please.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: A glass of your finest local spirits!

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Water. Just water.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: As you wish. Pray join your friends, and I will bring you your drink.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: Your drink is on its way. Please, have a seat.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Welcome back. Whatever did the Radiant want with you, pray tell?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Our allies have sent military delegates? That's news to me. Mind sharing the details?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Final Days─how far has the phenomenon spread, and how does it manifest itself in each land? I must reach out to my friends in each nation and find out all I can.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Ahhh...!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, I suppose I do feel better on a full stomach, after all. Burning skies? Blasphemies? Not if I've got anything to say about it!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If the Forum truly has been spurred to action by Hydaelyn's prophecy, then is it not odd that the Antitower was entrusted to Master Matoya, who bears them no love?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: No doubt She has a reason for this, and I would know what it is...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Nothing like a feast to lift the spirits. I trust you enjoyed yourself as well?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Beasts and blasphemies may be running amok in nearby lands outside the influence of Radz–at–Han and the alliance. If so, I may need to go hunting.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Now, then...is there anything we've forgotten to mention? Are your arms and armor in good order?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: In that case, it's time we each attended to our tasks. And when you arrive on the First, give my regards to Ryne. Tell her I miss her.
